alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 12:58AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 400 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain affecting windward sections of the Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour in the heaviest showers. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Kapaau, Honokaa, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Honomu, Mountain View, Hakalau, Glenwood, Ninole, Keaau, Volcano, Laupahoehoe, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates, Ookala, Paauilo and Pahoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 400 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
